project.teaser: EFFEREST targets a decisive leap forward in the novel use of data to achieve energy efficient electric vehicle (EV) designs, matching enhanced user acceptance with efficient vehicle operation. Significant improvements will be gained by leveraging knowledge from real fleet...
project.objective: EFFEREST targets a decisive leap forward in the novel use of data to achieve energy efficient electric vehicle (EV) designs, matching enhanced user acceptance with efficient vehicle operation. Significant improvements will be gained by leveraging knowledge from real fleet behaviour. Users will benefit from personalised data and the always-available option to select the vehicle performance type; in this way, users will perceive that individualised eco-functionality sufficiently fulfils normal daily-use requirements and will be motivated to save energy even over longer periods of regular usage. To achieve its ambition, EFFEREST brings together 11 partners from industrial and research backgrounds covering the entire EV value chain. A co-design framework will be implemented with a holistic user-centric energy management system control architecture based on adaptive digital twins, model-based optimization for component rightsizing, predictive model-based control and AI, benefitting from V2X, fleet-generated information and historical data. Most importantly, novel indicators will be identified that provide deeper insight into the effect that technical improvements have on user experience: this will help to derive more realistic development targets with a direct impact on user attractiveness, which in turn will impact the controllers that will be tailored adaptively to the current condition of the specific EV and its usage pattern, thus providing personalized and robust behaviour. Innovations in powertrains, battery systems, heating, ventilation and air conditioning systems will then be demonstrated through extensive evaluations in test facilities and a demonstrator vehicle, the aim being to make EVs more energy-efficient, comfortable, safe and affordable. As such, EFFEREST will increase the competitiveness of Europe, strengthening industrial leadership in key digital, enabling and emerging technologies to make EVs more attractive for the worldwide mass market.
project.title: EFFicient user-centric EneRgy managEment SysTems for optimized EVs
project.keywords: electric vehicles, thermal management, energy management system, holistic user-centric solutions

article.title: Paving the way for electric vehicle efficiency

result.title: Initial Data Management Plan
result.description: This document sets out how research data will be collected, generated and handled within the project, taking into account the FAIR principles. This deliverable will updated in M18. This deliverable is linked to task 1.3.

result.title: Initial communication, dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: This document collects the action plan to maximise impact, covering the Dissemination, Communication & Exploitation activities. This deliverable will be updated in M18. This deliverable is linked to task 1.5.

result.title: Self-adaptive neural network model predictive anti-jerk control of electric powertrains

details.authors: Gianluca Frison, Fabio Alberti, Luca Ciravegna, Luca Dimauro, Aldo Sorniotti

result.title: European Initiatives for User-Centric Design of Electric Vehicles

details.authors: Florian Ratz, Thomas Bäuml, Tomaž Kompara, Alexander Kospach, Dragan Simic, Petra Jan, Sebastian Möller, Hiroyuki Fuse, Esteban Parades Barros, Eric Armengaud, Nicola Amati, Aldo Sorniotti, Walter Lukesch

result.title: State-of-the-art vehicles and demo-vehicle benchmark report
result.description: The deliverable presents the results of the benchmark of state-of-the-art and demo EV will be available regarding different KPIs relevant to this call. This deliverable is linked to the task 2.2.

result.title: High-fidelity simulation and adaptive digital twin models
result.description: Report including description of modelling approach, simulation setup, boundary conditions and simulation results for data creation. This deliverable is linked to task 3.2.

result.title: Mid-term communication and dissemination plan
result.description: This document will collected the implemented activities related to Dissemination and Communication during the first 18 months of the project.

result.title: Quality Assurance, Risk Management and Project Management Plan
result.description: This document describes all procedures of the project. It includes the work breakdown, risk management, quality assurance, templates and guidelines. This deliverables is linked to task 1.1

result.title: Project identity and web presence
result.description: Detailed description of the project identity, website, dissemination and communication materials, including templates. This deliverable is linked to task 1.5.

category.title: control systems
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/control systems

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
